description: The Flamboni carries our most powerful flame cannon and serves as our project support vehicle. Shoots flame plumes and rolling fireballs 30 feet in the air!  We stretched a golf cart frame to create the right proportion for this small-scale replica ice resurfacing machine and we custom fabbed the vintage bomber shark themed body.

points.heading: Specifications
points.description:
7 tons (14,250 lbs) or about the weight of 4 cars
The Walking Beast weighs more than most monster trucks!
Height 11 feet
Width 8 feet 4 inches
Length 24 feet
Ground Pressure 20.8 psi when standing on four legs
(as compared to 30 psi for a standard passenger car)

points.heading: Powered By
points.description:
454 cu. in. Big block Chevy V-8
TH400 transmission modified with 475 straight cut gears
Two Klune-V extreme under drive Goliath planetary gear reduction boxes
Rockwell 2 1/2 ton military differential modified with custom 5 ton parts
Final Drive Ratio is 125:1
Fuel Consumption is 2 gallons gasoline per mile (GPM)

points.heading: Construction
points.description:
Linkage - 6-bar linkage system designed and patented by Joe Klann for walking machines.
The Walking Beast linkage has 56 pivot points and uses 114 bearings.
Metals Used - Steel, aluminum, 1040, 4130, 4140, 4340, and 8620 chromium and molybdenum alloy
Method - Frame, legs and linkage are tubing cut, notched and welded, or CNC plasma cut, and then formed on a press brake and welded together to form box or angle structures. All pivot points and pins are CNC machined.
